contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|Gurkha}} {{TOC right}} '''Gurkha''' or '''Gorkha''' may also refer to: ==People== * [[Gurkha]], an ethnic group indigenous to [[Nepal]] * [[Gorkha regiments (India)]], regiments of the modern Indian Army, successors of the Gurkhas of Britain's imperial Indian Army. * [[Indian Gorkha]], the Nepali/Gorkhali-speaking people of India. * Gorkhali, the more common term, refers to the people of the former Gorkha Kingdom which lies in present-day [[Gorkha District]] of Nepal. ==Places== * [[Kingdom of Nepal]], also called the Gorkha Kingdom * [[Gorkha District]], a district of Nepal * [[Gorkhaland]], the name of the proposed state in India demanded by the Gorkha ethnic group * Another name for [[Prithbinarayan]], a Nepali city ==Companies== * [[Gorkha Airlines]], an Airline in Nepal * [[Gorkha Beer]], a brand of beer brewed in Nepal * [[Gurkha (cigar)]], a brand of premium cigars ==Organizations== * [[Bharatiya Gorkha Parisangh]], a national-level organization of Indian Gorkhas * [[Bharatiya Gorkhali Welfare Association]], a non-political social organization of the Gorkhas * [[Darjeeling Gorkha Hill Council]], a semi-autonomous body that looks after the administration of the District of Darjeeling * [[Gorkha Janmukti Morcha]], a political party in Darjeeling district and Dooars, India * [[Gorkha National Liberation Front]], a political party in North Bengal, India ==Other uses== * [[Gurkha War]], wars fought between Nepal and the British East India Company ==See also== * [[Kukri]], a curved knife also known as a Gurkha knife or Gurkha blade {{Disambiguation|geo|political}}
